oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A hexanuclear iron(III) complex [Fe(6)O(2)(OH)(2)(PhCOO)(10)(hedmp)(2)]center dot 3CH(3)CN assembled from 2-hydroxyethyl-3,5-dimethyl pyrazole
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MURUGAVEL, R
GOGOI, N
HOWLADER, R
CLERAC, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: polynuclear iron chemistry
5 ground-state
magnetic-properties
crystal-structures

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In order to assemble polynuclear iron(III) complexes, the coordination chemistry of the 2-hydroxyethyl3,5- dimethylpyrazole (hedmp-H) ligand has been investigated. Reaction of hedmp-H with trinuclear iron carboxylate precursor [Fe(3)O(PhCOO)(6)(H(2)O)(3)] Cl in acetonitrile yielded the hexanuclear Fe(III) complex [Fe(6)O(2)(OH)(2)(PhCOO)(10)(hedmp)(2)]center dot 3CH(3)CN (1). This aggregate has been characterized by employing various analytical techniques, spectroscopic studies and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Detailed magnetic susceptibility measurements revealed that 1 displays an S(T) = 5 ground state. (C) 2010 Elsevier B. V. .
